Security, Law enforcement.

contributors.headline: NCI Agency Registry Manager & Senior Archivist na NATO Communications and Information Agency (NCI Agency)

projects.title: Former SHAPE Technical Center (STC) Library records and archives transfer to NATO Archives
projects.description: After the closure of the SHAPE Technical Library and the lack of awareness, its content was at risk of being simply disposed or destroyed.  Therefore I took the initiative to set up a "Tiger Team" comprised of the Agency Librarian, Technical Researcher and myself, in order appraised, selected and preserve all the technical publications, records and archives of permanente, historical and technical value. The project was initiated in December 20019, single handedly by one of my Registry clerks at Mons (Mrs. Beata Wawrzonek), under my management, with the supervision of the NATO Archives and concluded when all records and archives were successfully transferred to the NATO Archives at the NNHQ/Brussels in  November 2020.

contributors.headline: NCI Agency Registry Manager & Senior Archivist na NATO Communications and Information Agency (NCI Agency)

projects.title: NCI Agency Records and Archives from Bâtiment Z, to the NATO Archives in the NNHQ.
projects.description:
Following the preparations leading to the Agency move to the NNHQ and due to the scarce space allocation predicted for storage purposes, 
I was tasked by my Management (GSD) to assess the viability of transferring some of the Agency records (archives), currently stored in the basement and in some corridors within Bâtiment Z, to the NATO Archives in the NNHQ. A "Tiger team" was assembled from all directorates (GS, HR, Security, Finance, Legal, Facilities Management) under my management and the supervision of the NATO Archives. A plan was drafted and put in practice in order to assess, appraise, sort and box all relevant records and archives of permanent value to be safeguarded and ingested onto the NATO Archives holding at the NNHQ/Brussels. This project was initiated in 2016 an successfully concluded in 2018.

contributors.headline: NCI Agency Registry Manager & Senior Archivist na NATO Communications and Information Agency (NCI Agency)

projects.title: NATO Support to African Union - SMLO Office
projects.description:
NATO’s support to the African Union started in 2005 with assistance to the AU Mission in Sudan (AMIS). This was the Alliance’s first mission on the African continent and as such represents a landmark decision by the North Atlantic Council. Since then, NATO has committed to support other AU missions and objectives. 
More specifically, with regard to NATO’s support to the AU mission in Sudan (AMIS), the Joint Command Lisbon – under the overall command of Allied Command Operations - had the responsibility for the NATO Senior Military Liaison Officer (SMLO) team operating out of Addis Ababa. 

The SMLO team was NATO's single military point of contact in Addis Ababa with the African Union. In addition, it was the NATO military point of contact with the representatives of the countries contributing troops to the AMIS operation, the representatives of the donor nations pledging support to the African Union, the United Nations, the European Union and various embassies.

I was tasked by the SMLO to act as Office Manager for the mission, to set up a new  permanent office and act as responsible for contracting, purchasing, implementing and managing all logistical/security/budgetary (reporting directly to JFCLB J8), aspects for the SMLO Office in Addis Ababa.

profile_positions.location: NATO/ACO Joint Force Command Lisbon, Oeiras, Portugal
profile_positions.description:
The incumbent’s duties are:
Gives timely advice to the Section Head on matters of interest received from or originated within the AOR and provides them with recommendations when appropriate.
Implements procedures and guidance on archiving and document management received from Higher HQ level.
Writes and retains responsibility for maintaining JFCLB directives on records management and archiving for the peacetime headquarters and for JFCLB-led operations.
Directs and oversees the document security organization of JFCLB and supervises the Registry for proper
records management and archiving procedures.valuates records for preservation and retention.
Prepares record-keeping systems and procedures for archival and for the retention or destruction of records.
Advises users on best practices on access, use and interpretation of archives, when needed through the
provision of training sessions on archiving procedures.
Executes policy and issues guidance on all matters regarding archiving within JFCLB.
Directs and oversees the registry function of JFCLB.
Budget authority is held: Oversees the HQ budget for the acquisition and implementation of records
management and archiving tools.
profile_positions.title: Senior Archivist/Registry Manager - NATO Civilian staff

profile_positions.location: NATO/ACO  Joint Force Command Lisbon, Oeiras, Portugal
profile_positions.description:
Information manager for the office of the Deputy Commander (DCOM)/Chief Of Staff (COS).
Provide daily admin support.
Drafts routine social correspondence and prepares final version of documents and letters for the DCOM/COS.
Processes and files document correspondence, and letters.
Takes minutes and keeps records of meetings, as directed, and transcribes notes into final report format.
Assists in managing DCOM/COS’s calendar.
Processes all invitations, incoming and outgoing, prepares guest lists, invitations and support documentation for all social functions hosted by DCOM/COS.
Co-ordinates support service for ceremonies and events.
Prepares and plans DCOM/COS’s duty travel arrangements and related administrative matters.
Drafts staff notices when events originate in the Deputy Commander/Chief of Staff office, in coordination with the Coordination Officer.
Act as the initial point of contact for all telephone calls and visitors to the DCOM/COS office, screening, prioritizing and handling as appropriate. Ensure that all calls and visitors are either handled or forwarded to appropriate personal staff for appropriate action. 
Provides and maintains office supplies and stationary to the office of the DCOM/COS.
Performs special projects as assigned.
Provides administrative, travel and protocol arrangements for the DCOM/COS visit and social engagement.
Draft outgoing correspondence and messages required by the DCOM/COS as required
profile_positions.title: Deputy Commander/Chief Of Staff Staff Assistant

profile_positions.description:
Conscript in 1991 achieving the rank of Corporal.
 In 1993 applied to attend the Army NCO School.
Graduated in 1995 as Cavalry Sergeant, qualified in Armor, Mechanized Recce and Military Police. During my military career attended successfully the following qualification courses: Irregular Ops; Military Instructor; Urban Combat warfare instructor; Airborne; HUMINT operator; Military and Intelligence Security operator; Crowd Riot Control (CRC) instructor; CIMIC operator.
Deploying for the following missions: 
1Tour in Kosovo (NATO KFOR) 99/00
1Tour in East Timor (UNTAET) 2001
1Tour in Ethiopia (NS2AU) 2006

Prepares briefing material for the Division Head J1 under supervision of the SO (Manpower/Personnel).

profile_positions.location: NATO Support to African Union, Addis Ababa - Ethiopia
profile_positions.description:

Manage the day to day ground transportation requirements and oversight of contracted drivers.
Manage all incoming information/correspondence and incoming/outgoing restricted data.

Manage accommodation requirements for long and short term stays.
